parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular

str2: (including the other inflections); from toi and houtos; truly this, i.e. Of this sort (to denote character or individuality).
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
And if, whether. From ei and te; if too.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
And if, whether. From ei and te; if too.
Apart from, separately from; without. Adverb from chora; at a space, i.e. Separately or apart from.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular

str2: A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
